channel.title: Blog on Joe Lauletta
channel.description: Recent content in Blog on Joe Lauletta

item.title: Ride the bull before it tramples you
item.description: As AI advances, my definition of creativity will have to become more flexible. In a way, this might be the gun to my head that I needed the whole time. I want to think that the average person is so lazy that GPT may never become a household name no matter how streamlined / forced down our throats it gets, but look at how easily we’ve adopted every other technology.

item.title: A special retrospective
item.description: It took me five years to finish high school. I dragged my therapists and guidance counselors through a logistical obstacle course instead of getting a GED and calling it a day. Obviously this is water under the bridge 6 years past graduation, but as I look through email correspondences from that mess of a time, I recognize an early case of my obsessive need to prove my worth by taking on unnecessary burdens.

item.title: God is real and I connected with him on LinkedIn
item.description: Some of us go for the four-year computer science degree at Big State University, pre-gaming for exclusive job fairs with adderall. Some of us like to eat paint and binge watch Top 10 Things You Need To Learn As A Minimalist Soydev videos all day until we hit 10,000 hours and reach Gladwell status. Personally, I went to Jared. I obsessed over guitar for half my life, then I watched the masterpiece that is Mr.
